abstract: Chevron and other big oil players face daunting problems with their operations in North Sea; plummeting oil prices and increased extraction costs due to aging infrastructure have made efficiency questionable at best; companies are attempting to trim operations and seek new ways to bolster extraction as they seek to preserve energy region that gives Europe one of its only hedges against reliance on foreign oil.
lead_paragraph: Oil producers in Britain are contending with plummeting prices as they seek new ways to bolster the aging infrastructure of the North Sea industry.

headline.main: Chevron and North Sea Rivals Race to Keep an Oil Region Relevant
headline.print_headline: Troubles for Oil Drillers in Scottish Waters

snippet: Oil producers in Britain are contending with plummeting prices as they seek new ways to bolster the aging infrastructure of the North Sea industry.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
